page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: The most prominent feature in the landscape of our area is the Eildon Hills.These are three peaks rising from the Tweed valley. The rest of our area is mostly rural farmland.Bowden is the only reasonably sized residential area.There are three large farms in our area,all of them have rough grazing land for sheep and some have a few fields in which they grow turnips,potatoes,oilseed-rape and other crops.One farm also has a herd of 200 beef cattle. Here and there can be seen groups of coniferous trees and a few clumps of deciduous trees.There are many old disused quarries and an ancient earthwork,there are also a few old wells.
